channel.title: How to delete command line history?
channel.description: Hi All, I'm new here and still learning Kicksecure. On other Linux distros, if I want to delete my command line history, I can use `history -c && history -w`. These command options seem to be missing from Kicksecure. What is the Kickescure way to do this? If anyone has a link about how Kicksecure handles the history command, I would be happy to read it. There are probably security and privacy concerns around the history command, so I could see why Kicksecure wouldn't use the Linux defaults for it. Any help is greatly appreciated!

item.title: How to delete command line history?
item.dc:creator: viandi
item.source: How to delete command line history?

item.title: How to delete command line history?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The relevant difference is, that Kicksecure uses zsh by default. (Default Interactive Shell)

Hence, documentation corresponding for zsh should be fuctional.

Read full topic
item.source: How to delete command line history?
